module.p: blàth warm is a simple adjective.

crodh blàth warm cattle –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. [...] Bha latha briagha ann agus bha a’ ghrian a’ deàrrsadh. [...] Bha an crodh blàth le teas na gréine agus bha iad ’nan seasamh anns na lochan beaga a bha an siud ’s an seo air feadh a’ mhonaidh.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. [...] It was a beautiful day and the sun was shining. [...] The cattle were warm with the heat of the sun and they were standing in the little lakes which were here and there throughout the moor. td. 146

seòmar blàth a warm room –
Tha an seomar glé bhlàth.
The room is very warm. td. 14
A bheil an seòmar seo blàth?
Is this room warm? td. 14

latha blàth a warm day –
Tha latha briagha blàth ann.
It is a beautiful warm day. td. 14 [228] [adapted]
Dh’ fhàg Màiri agus Seumas an taigh tràth anns a’ mhadainn. Bha an latha blàth, agus bha na h-eòin a’ seinn anns na craobhan.
Mary and James left the house early in the morning. The day was warm, and the birds were singing in the trees. td. 76 [adapted]

samhradh blàth a warm summer –
Tha an samhradh blàth.
The summer is warm. td. 65

aimsir bhlàth warm weather –
Bha an aimsir blàth am bliadhna.
The weather was warm this year. td. 62
